Hunter_001.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Gur CampApproach the camp and talk to Gur Leader and the Entrance Guard.Click on this Gur Hunter.

Intro_NoAstarion.synopsis: Ulma, the leader of Gur Tribe, talks to the player while Astarion is not around. If Gandrel (Gur Hunter from Act 1) is alive, also present. Ulma speaks in an accented lilt - English is not her first language.Scene Trigger - WYR_GurCamp_Intro_SceneTrigger_8c9acc78-9d97-4d0f-919e-3997c015ed7f

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader.synopsis: Repeated group AD between the Gur Leader and two members of the Gur Tribe.

Hunter_006.synopsis: One-liner with a Gur Hunter at the Gur Camp in Wyrm's Crossing. Hunter is morose, fatalistic.
Hunter_006.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Gur CampApproach the camp and talk to Gur Leader and the Entrance Guard.Click on this Gur Hunter.

Hunter_002.synopsis: One-liner with a Gur Hunter at the Gur Camp in Wyrm's Crossing
Hunter_002.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Gur CampApproach the camp and talk to Gur Leader and the Entrance Guard.Click on this Gur Hunter.

GurHunter_0.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_0.text: It is not me you need to speak to. Ulma will see you.

GurHunter_1.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_1.text: I apologise, my friend, but we need the spawn - not you.

GurHunter_2.speaker: Gandrel
GurHunter_2.text: We can do nothing for you here. All that is left is to face the beast Cazador.

Hunter_003_0.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
Hunter_003_0.text: I pray you will succeed where we failed. Exterminate every last vampire parasite.

Hunter_003_1.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
Hunter_003_1.text: You're talking to the wrong hunter. You need to see Ulma.

Hunter_003_2.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
Hunter_003_2.text: Every last bloodsucker needs to be wiped from this plane.

Hunter_004_0.speaker: Godfrey Mordels
Hunter_004_0.text: Our dead fought well. They died well. I hope I can live up to their example.

Hunter_004_1.speaker: Godfrey Mordels
Hunter_004_1.text: My people do not die in our beds. It is not our way.

Hunter_001_1.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
Hunter_001_1.text: You think you can just walk into our camp? Present yourself to Ulma or leave.

Hunter_001_2.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
Hunter_001_2.text: We are begging help from you? After your pet spawn killed Gandrel?

Hunter_001_3.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
Hunter_001_3.text: I would follow Ulma to the Hells and back, but this does not feel right.

Hunter_001_4.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
Hunter_001_4.text: We are begging help from you? An outsider?

GurLeader_AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.text: I will not lose. I cannot lose!

Intro_NoAstarion_14.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_14.text: If you will not help us, we do not need you here.

Intro_NoAstarion_51.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing, NodeContext: REK tay ee HATH-ran ROOST

Intro_NoAstarion_9.speaker: Narrator
Intro_NoAstarion_9.text: *You recognise the words - Gur funeral rites. To hear them is rare: the Gur monster hunters are as formidable as they are secretive.*

Intro_NoAstarion_159.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_159.text: My friend from the hag swamp? You are a bright light on a dark day.

Intro_NoAstarion_167.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_167.text: We underestimated an enemy. Much like I underestimated you and your vampiric companion.

Intro_NoAstarion_42.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_42.text: Oh yes, I know you hid him from me. But this is not the moment to discuss it. This is about the dead, not the undead.

Intro_NoAstarion_162.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_162.text: Prayers for the fallen - we are burning their belongings so they may fight on in the next life. Battling monsters like your pale friend, perhaps.

Intro_NoAstarion_8.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_8.text: Prayers for the fallen. We are burning their belongings so they may fight on in the afterlife.

Intro_NoAstarion_197.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_197.text: Frey vald isk durovna. Frey vald isk ablast.
Intro_NoAstarion_197.context: NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

Intro_NoAstarion_65.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_65.text: Our tribe left camp on a rescue mission. Only Ulma and those you see here returned.
Intro_NoAstarion_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nodding to Ulma, the camp matriach, standing in front of him. She's by a funeral pyre, leading prayers, so a small distance away

Intro_NoAstarion_145.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_145.text: Did they save whoever they set out to rescue?

Intro_NoAstarion_151.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_151.text: Im orak ne tay. Krasin ne trah!
Intro_NoAstarion_151.context: NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

Intro_NoAstarion_47.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_47.text: I will say no more. It is not my tale to tell.

Intro_NoAstarion_45.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_45.text: No, that shame is mine alone.
Intro_NoAstarion_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Approaching the players from the direction of the campfireNodeContext: Approaching the players from the direction of the campfire

Intro_NoAstarion_11.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_11.text: I thought I knew the faces of all your friends, Gandrel, but this one is new to me.

Intro_NoAstarion_199.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_199.text: A friend met on the road, my lady. I told you of the stranger in the swamp?
Intro_NoAstarion_199.context: InternalNodeContext: 'friend' and 'stranger' refer to the player

Intro_NoAstarion_44.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_44.text: I didn't know this was a funeral. I'm sorry for your loss.

Intro_NoAstarion_196.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_196.text: Those who have left us will be celebrated, not mourned. They died well, after all.

Intro_NoAstarion_21.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_21.text: And this is the one I spoke of, my lady - the stranger I met while hunting the spawn.

Intro_NoAstarion_98.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_98.text: They killed not only that fen's hag, but also the undying General Thorm, if the rumours are true.

Intro_NoAstarion_54.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_54.text: Two fine trophies. Perhaps I can interest you in a third?

Intro_NoAstarion_89.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_89.text: Perhaps. What do you have in mind?

Intro_NoAstarion_18.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_18.text: Baldur's Gate is haunted by many things, but one of its most insidious is the vampire Cazador.

Intro_NoAstarion_153.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_153.text: For years, his foul spawn have stolen away innocents at night, whisking them back to his palace. Recently, they struck our camp.

Intro_NoAstarion_134.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_134.text: They took our children. Every last one - our whole future.

Intro_NoAstarion_204.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_204.text: We are monster hunters all - our purpose is to kill beasts like these. But in our haste to save our little ones, we were rash. We charged straight into an ambush.

Intro_NoAstarion_203.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_203.text: They tore us to pieces - vampire spawn and werewolves - I have never seen a vampire's lair so heavily guarded.

Intro_NoAstarion_13.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_13.text: What's left of my tribe is wounded and broken - we cannot stand against him to save our children. But perhaps the slayer of Ketheric could?

Intro_NoAstarion_64.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_64.text: A noble goal. I will not ask you to deviate from it, but know that this city holds other dangers too.

Intro_NoAstarion_99.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_99.text: In the city lives Cazador Szarr, a powerful man - a respected man. A man known to host lavish, hedonistic banquets in his palace.

Intro_NoAstarion_112.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_112.text: But behind the façade, there is a monster. A vampire who has made Baldur's Gate a feeding ground and his palace an abattoir.

Intro_NoAstarion_171.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_171.text: We suspect he holds his victims somewhere below his mansion. And we fear our missing children are among them.

Intro_NoAstarion_189.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_189.text: We tried to save them and paid a heavy price. But perhaps the slayer of Ketheric could succeed where we failed?

Intro_NoAstarion_176.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_176.text: I admit, I am surprised. I thought your pale companion would kill for a chance to face his old master.

Intro_NoAstarion_58.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_58.text: This is the one who hid the spawn from you?
Intro_NoAstarion_58.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'this', a little shocked/annoyed

Intro_NoAstarion_31.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_31.text: Astarion isn't responsible for the crimes Cazador forced him to commit.

Intro_NoAstarion_96.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_96.text: A vampire spawn is doubly cursed - first to be a slave, but still to be a monster. He is not so innocent.

Intro_NoAstarion_101.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_101.text: No, but he may be useful.

Intro_NoAstarion_109.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_109.text: I thought you were going to kill him!

Intro_NoAstarion_17.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_17.text: I admit, I would have relished it. But his death would not have served us well.

Intro_NoAstarion_130.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_130.text: The spawn can infiltrate Cazador's palace in a way we never could. And he could take you with him.

Intro_NoAstarion_94.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_94.text: Together you could save those stolen from us and help your companion destroy his old master. We would all be free.

Intro_NoAstarion_169.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_169.text: If you do this, our entire tribe will be in your debt. On our honour, it will be repaid.

Intro_NoAstarion_77.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_77.text: May the gods keep you and damn your enemies.

Intro_NoAstarion_183.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_183.text: How am I meant to get in if this palace is so well guarded?

Intro_NoAstarion_155.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_155.text: The main entrance is blockaded, but there is another way. Near the park, you will find a broken tower, mid-repair. Climb the scaffolding and you can enter his palace.

Intro_NoAstarion_137.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_137.text: It may be watched, but you will not walk into the slaughter that we did.

Intro_NoAstarion_4.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_4.text: And if it's too late to save your children?

Intro_NoAstarion_180.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_180.text: Then we will settle for blood.

Intro_NoAstarion_111.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_111.text: Cazador must be destroyed. For the safety of the city, and to make sure no one else must feel our pain.

Intro_NoAstarion_40.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_40.text: I'll chop him into so many bits you won't know he was a vampire.

Intro_NoAstarion_136.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_136.text: I have other battles to fight.

Intro_NoAstarion_142.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_142.text: Very well, but I pray you do not save yourself from one terror only to fall to the next.

Intro_NoAstarion_49.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_49.text: Please, will you take him now? He's so annoying.

Intro_NoAstarion_87.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_87.text: Alas, now he is more valuable with you.

Intro_NoAstarion_24.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_24.text: Slay the vampire, claim his head, and free our children. Please.

Intro_NoAstarion_16.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_16.text: I'll see what can be done.

Intro_NoAstarion_78.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_78.text: I'm sorry for your loss, but I have my own fight.

Intro_NoAstarion_63.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_63.text: Yeah, I'm definitely not doing that.

Intro_NoAstarion_33.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_33.text: I take no pride in killing nor trophies from it. Sometimes it simply must be done.

Intro_NoAstarion_190.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_190.text: It is a solemn task - one this city forces us to undertake time and again.

Intro_NoAstarion_141.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_141.text: And they went on to kill the undying General Thorm, if the rumours are true.

Intro_NoAstarion_108.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_108.text: A fine trophy. Perhaps you would like to claim another?

Intro_NoAstarion_191.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_191.text: You said those rites beautifully - I'm sorry for your loss.

Intro_NoAstarion_160.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_160.text: Gandrel was just telling me how you got your arse kicked.

Intro_NoAstarion_115.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_115.text: Crude, but not untrue. And who is this, Gandrel?

Intro_NoAstarion_93.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_93.text: A risk was taken. Unfortunately, it led to disaster.

Intro_NoAstarion_166.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_166.text: So... did you ever find that vampire spawn?

Intro_NoAstarion_192.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_192.text: I did not. Although I suspect you knew that much already.

Intro_NoAstarion_133.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_133.text: I did not. He slipped by me, although how I do not know.

Intro_NoAstarion_174.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_174.text: I pledge your dead my respects - your quarry must have been impressive.

Intro_NoAstarion_156.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_156.text: I see you have studied our tongue, friend. You are quite correct - we underestimated an enemy.

Intro_NoAstarion_80.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_80.text: Welcome, friend. You find us on a solemn day.

Intro_NoAstarion_179.speaker: Gandrel
Intro_NoAstarion_179.text: There is no need - all are welcome to remember the fallen.

Intro_NoAstarion_67.speaker: Narrator
Intro_NoAstarion_67.text: *She's speaking the language of the Gur people, one influenced by ancient Rashemi tongues. She's praying for the fallen of her tribe as their possessions are burned.*

Intro_NoAstarion_161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

Intro_NoAstarion_36.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_36.text: I do not know if showing your face here is brave or stupid, given the company you keep.

Intro_NoAstarion_188.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_188.text: Do you even know the sins of the one you travel with? The one you protect?

Intro_NoAstarion_187.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_187.text: You'll have to be more specific - I know some interesting people.

Intro_NoAstarion_88.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_88.text: You have travelled with Astarion, a spawn sired and raised by the vampire Cazador.

Intro_NoAstarion_100.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_100.text: I know the Gur people have a history with a vampire spawn named Astarion.

Intro_NoAstarion_68.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_68.text: Yes, we are familiar with Astarion.

Intro_NoAstarion_26.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_26.text: The same Astarion that came in the night with his wretched siblings and stole away my tribe's children.

Intro_NoAstarion_6.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_6.text: The same Astarion who killed our kin Gandrel and left him to rot in a hag's swamp.

Intro_NoAstarion_140.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_140.text: His crimes against my people are legion. His name is cursed on our lips.

Intro_NoAstarion_146.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_146.text: But even so, there are others whose crimes are greater.

Intro_NoAstarion_83.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_83.text: Lady, I have no idea who you are.

Intro_NoAstarion_184.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_184.text: I am Ulma, leader of what remains of my tribe. Your vampiric friend stole away our children, and we have lost many trying to save them.

Intro_NoAstarion_7.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_7.text: But alas, taking our revenge on him would likely doom us all.

Intro_NoAstarion_154.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_154.text: I would make peace with your Astarion. I would forgive him his sins if we can reach an accord.

Intro_NoAstarion_57.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_57.text: You'll forgive the person who stole your children?

Intro_NoAstarion_39.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_39.text: The children of my tribe were taken from us. Stolen in the night and brought to Cazador's palace by your friend and his siblings.

Intro_NoAstarion_29.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_29.text: We tried to save them, but his palace was too well defended.

Intro_NoAstarion_10.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_10.text: We were not able to save our children, but perhaps one of his own - your Astarion - could enter safely, destroy Cazador, and save them?

Intro_NoAstarion_173.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_173.text: All right, I'll talk to Astarion.

Intro_NoAstarion_2.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_2.text: My thanks. I only pray his anger at his old master burns as brightly as ours.

Intro_NoAstarion_12.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_12.text: What can you tell me about Cazador's lair?

Intro_NoAstarion_157.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_157.text: Less than I'd like. We made it to the main hall before his slaves attacked.

Intro_NoAstarion_38.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_38.text: And why in the hells would Astarion take you up on this?

Intro_NoAstarion_3.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_3.text: Perhaps he will not. Perhaps he is the monster we believe him to be.

Intro_NoAstarion_0.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_0.text: But if he is not, he has a chance to do some good today. To set right a little of the pain he has caused in his miserable existence.

Intro_NoAstarion_110.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_110.text: He won't make a deal with you and neither will I.

Intro_NoAstarion_102.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_102.text: A pity. You had a chance to cleanse his hands of some blood.

Intro_NoAstarion_178.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_178.text: But I will enjoy ridding this world of one more monster.

Intro_NoAstarion_152.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_152.text: I don't travel with Astarion anymore. He's long gone.

Intro_NoAstarion_118.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_118.text: Can it be true? Perhaps you are more powerful than I give you credit for.

Intro_NoAstarion_81.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_81.text: If you have taken one undead trophy, perhaps I can interest you in another?

Intro_NoAstarion_56.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_56.text: Maybe Gandrel didn't leave him much choice.

Intro_NoAstarion_116.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_116.text: Gandrel was doing his duty, trying to save our tribe's future.

Intro_NoAstarion_158.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_158.text: But no matter - he is gone and the past is done. I wish to discuss the future.

Intro_NoAstarion_186.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_186.text: In Astarion's defence, the look on Gandrel's face as he died was priceless.

Intro_NoAstarion_181.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_181.text: I thought perhaps we could talk, but no. There is no common ground here.

Intro_NoAstarion_170.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_170.text: You are a roach upon the world. It will be a pleasure to stamp you out.

Intro_NoAstarion_95.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_95.text: Oh, they're nothing compared to my sins.

Intro_NoAstarion_143.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_143.text: This may be true, but your sins have not been visited upon us. Unlike your campmate Astarion.

Intro_NoAstarion_194.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_194.text: We would not normally tolerate outsiders at a time like this.

Intro_NoAstarion_124.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_124.text: The slayer of Ketheric Thorm? Well, these are strange times indeed.

Intro_NoAstarion_70.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_70.text: My thanks. We grieve those who left us, but celebrate them too. They died well.

Intro_NoAstarion_139.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_139.text: There is doom in the air these days, but welcome news too. Word has reached me that the undying Ketheric Thorm is destroyed.

Intro_NoAstarion_86.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_86.text: And if whispered tales can be believed, he was defeated by one looking much like you.

Intro_NoAstarion_104.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_104.text: The head of the shadow-cursed warlord is an impressive trophy. I am wondering if I could tempt you with another.

Intro_NoAstarion_182.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_182.text: I'm just a traveller - I've never heard of this 'Ketheric', let alone killed him.

Intro_NoAstarion_148.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_148.text: No? A pity - the head of the shadow-cursed warlord would have made a fine trophy.

Intro_NoAstarion_52.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_52.text: But perhaps I can interest you in claiming another prize?

Intro_NoAstarion_202.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_202.text: You find us honouring our dead. Celebrating those who fell in battle trying to save our tribe.

Intro_NoAstarion_22.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_22.text: Speak the traditional Rashemi blessing for fallen warriors.

Intro_NoAstarion_193.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_193.text: Thank you, kin. You honour our fallen in these dark times.

Intro_NoAstarion_30.speaker: Player
Intro_NoAstarion_30.text: Well, here I am. What are you going to do about it?

Intro_NoAstarion_195.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_195.text: Nothing, for these are not normal times.

Intro_NoAstarion_135.speaker: Narrator
Intro_NoAstarion_135.text: *You recognise the language of the Gur people, sprinkled with words from ancient Rashemi tongues, but you cannot follow what's being said.*

Intro_NoAstarion_113.speaker: Narrator
Intro_NoAstarion_113.text: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - famed monster hunters. She's burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*

Intro_NoAstarion_92.speaker: Narrator
Intro_NoAstarion_92.text: *You've clearly walked into some kind of ceremony, but it's nothing that you recognise.*

Intro_NoAstarion_147.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_147.text: We await an audience with your spawn.

Intro_NoAstarion_198.speaker: Ulma
Intro_NoAstarion_198.text: Do not stand here and wait - Cazador must be destroyed!

Hunter_005_0.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
Hunter_005_0.text: No screaming children, no laughter, no scolding words. There is only silence and pain.

Hunter_005_1.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
Hunter_005_1.text: Our camp has never been so quiet. I detest it.

GurLeader_AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_0.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_0.text: I have suffered one defeat already - I will not suffer another.

GurLeader_Dead_ByCazador_14.speaker: Narrator
GurLeader_Dead_ByCazador_14.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

GurLeader_Dead_ByCazador_1.speaker: Player
GurLeader_Dead_ByCazador_1.text: What does Cazador need Astarion for?

GurLeader_Dead_ByCazador_17.speaker: Narrator
GurLeader_Dead_ByCazador_17.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_2.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_2.text: Forgive me. I know tears will not bring our children back.
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_2.context: NodeContext: Slightly cracked voice, holding back tears

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_0.speaker: Ulma
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_0.text: There is nothing to forgive. It is only right to mourn.

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_10.speaker: Pumler Grejit
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_10.text: We shed tears today so we may shed blood tomorrow.

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_4.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_4.text: What will we do? There are so few of us left.

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_6.speaker: Ulma
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_6.text: Our strength was never numbers, but the bonds we share. And they are stronger than ever.

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_1.speaker: Pumler Grejit
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_1.text: As long as we stand together, we can never be truly broken.

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_7.speaker: Pumler Grejit
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_7.text: Cazador's nest of serpents must be exterminated. Nothing less will do.

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_5.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_5.text: And if our children still live? What will happen to them if we attack?

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_3.speaker: Ulma
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_3.text: I share your fear, but we cannot build plans on fear. We will have to act, for all our sakes.

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_9.speaker: Ulma
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_9.text: We let emotion cloud our judgement and it almost doomed us. We need strategy and cool heads.

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_8.speaker: Dominica Arsetz
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_8.text: Should we fortify the camp? Wait for the vampires to strike here?

AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_11.speaker: Pumler Grejit
AD_GroupADWithGurLeader_11.text: And let them marshal all their strength against us? I do not like our chances.

GurLeader_0.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_0.text: Too many have fallen, but our vengeance shall burn brighter than any pyre.

GurLeader_1.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_1.text: I would see that vampire burn, no matter what the cost.

Hunter_006_1.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
Hunter_006_1.text: To lose our children is a tragedy. To fail so utterly in saving them is something else entirely.

Hunter_006_0.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
Hunter_006_0.text: Ulma insists the tribe is not cursed, but I have my doubts.

Hunter_006_2.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
Hunter_006_2.text: First we lose our children, then Gandrel, and now this?

Hunter_006_3.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
Hunter_006_3.text: Perhaps the gods have abandoned us. Perhaps they have abandoned all of Faerûn.

Hunter_002_0.speaker: Pumler Grejit
Hunter_002_0.text: It is good to have you with us. There is something rotten at the heart of this city and it needs purging.

Hunter_002_1.speaker: Pumler Grejit
Hunter_002_1.text: I hope you will take everything from the vampires, as they have taken everything from us.

Hunter_002_2.speaker: Narrator
Hunter_002_2.text: *The hunter has nothing to say to you. He seems to have other things on his mind.*

AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_1.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_1.text: I'll destroy every last bloodsucker, I swear it.

AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_3.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_3.text: There'll always be more. They spread like locusts.

AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_0.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_0.text: So we should do nothing? Just wait for the next wave?

AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_2.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_2.text: We cannot rush into their claws again. Another defeat will wipe us out.

AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_5.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_5.text: What if this is it for our people? What if this is the end?

AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_4.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_4.text: Then we should end it on our terms, not hiding in fear.

AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_7.speaker: Katelyn Lerskin
AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_7.text: They need to be wiped out - exterminated. Nothing less will do.

AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_6.speaker: Oliver Quarlic
AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_6.text: And if we fail? Who will stand between them and the innocent?

AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_8.speaker: Cassivora Dophir
AD_GroupDialogBetweenHunters_8.text: If we do nothing, the innocent will suffer just the same. We have no good choices.

GurLeader_AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat_0.speaker: Ulma
GurLeader_AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat_0.text: Stay strong, hunters! Remember your training.
